other_tests.findings: Revealed an exophytic mass 15 cm from the anal verge, a polyp (0.6 cm) in the descending colon, and a second polyp (1.25 cm) in the distal rectal vault.
Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma arising in a villous adenoma with high-grade dysplasia; the polyps were tubular adenomas.
Palpated a mass 7 cm from the anus.
Apparent invasion through the muscularis propria into the perirectal fat; several malignant-appearing lymph nodes.
Reactive lymphoid tissue with no cancer.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Ink injected into an area of scarring to mark the site of the tumor.

other_tests.findings: 50% of the assessed markers showed instability, indicative of a mismatch-repair defect.
Isolated loss of nuclear staining for MSH6, indicating a germline mutation.
Showed a rectal mass causing abrupt narrowing of the rectal lumen, with several lymph nodes identified.
Showed soft-tissue thickening in the rectum with associated 18F-FDG uptake, several inguinal nodes, and no significant uptake in perirectal nodes.
Showed a rectosigmoid tumor, with extension beyond the muscularis propria and multiple perirectal and perisigmoid lymph nodes.
